name: Sprite
comment:
A few simple things for Sprite rendering with elm-html.

Usage is intended to be via the `sprite` function generating
styles for `Html.Attributes.style`. For example

```
node
    "sprite"
    [ style (sprite s) ]
    []
```

@docs Sprite, Dope, sprite, advance, advanceClamp

aliases.name: Dope
aliases.comment: The ordered frame coordinates representing an animation

aliases.name: Sprite
aliases.type: { a | sheet : String, rows : Int, columns : Int, size : ( Int, Int ), frame : Int, dope : Sprite.Dope }

values.name: advance
values.comment: Move the sprite forward one frame, such that it will loop when it reaches the end

values.name: advanceClamp
values.comment: Move the sprite forward one frame, such that it will stop when it reaches the end

values.name: sprite
values.comment:
Process a sprite into styles for application with
`elm-html`. Styles place the sprite sheet as a `background-image`
and animate by altering the `background-position`. `height`, `width`
are used for sizing, along with `display:block` for custom nodes.
